table-wrap.anchoringText: Well shut-in simulations were performed using the wellbore hydraulic models following the 5-year production conditions. A well restart scenario was also included to see if any well trajectory would lead to a restart failure. Fig. 38 shows the liquid holdup distribution in the wellbore after shutting down the wells for 1 day. It shows there are liquid slugs in the lateral sections of the toe-down, hold-toe-down, and oscillating trajectories. These liquid slugs will arrive at the surface separator and will be a challenge to handle after the well is restarted. Table 1 shows the total liquid volume in the wellbore after 1 day of shutting in.
table-wrap.label: Table 1
table-wrap.caption: Total liquid volume in the wellbore after shut-in.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Total liquid volume in the wellbore after shut-in.
